TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit FabricClient/ApplicationManagementClient extends System.Object

summary.para: Provides the functionality to manage Service Fabric applications.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyApplicationPackage (string imageStoreConnectionString, string applicationPackagePath, string applicationPackagePathInImageStore);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyApplicationPackage(string imageStoreConnectionString, string applicationPackagePath, string applicationPackagePathInImageStore) cil managed

param.name: imageStoreConnectionString
param.para: The connection string for the image store, which should match the "ImageStoreConnectionString" setting value found in the cluster manifest of the target cluster. In an on-premise cluster, the value is chosen during initial deployment by the cluster administrator. In an Azure cluster created through the Azure Resource Manager, this value is "fabric:ImageStore". The image store connection string value can be checked by looking at the cluster manifest contents returned by .

param.name: applicationPackagePath
param.para: The full path to the source application package.

param.name: applicationPackagePathInImageStore
param.para: The relative path for the destination in the Image Store. This path is created relative to the root directory in the image store and used as the destination for the application package copy.

summary.para: Uploads an application package to the Image Store in preparation for provisioning a new application type.

remarks.para: The timeout of the operation will default to 30 minutes for native image store and there is no timeout capacity for XStore and file share. Can also consider specifying proper timeout value in the overloading function

exception.para: There was an error accessing a file on the Image Store.
A required file was not found on the Image Store.
A required directory was not found on the Image Store.
A path to an Image Store file/directory was too long.
: There was an IO error communicating with the Image Store.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

param.name: timeout
param.para: The timeout of copying application package operation

summary.para: Uploads an application package to the Image Store in preparation for provisioning a new application type.

param.para: The connection string for the image store, which should match the "ImageStoreConnectionString" setting value found in the cluster manifest of the target cluster. In an on-premise cluster, the value is chosen during initial deployment by the cluster administrator. In an Azure cluster created through the Azure Resource Manager, this value is "fabric:ImageStore". The image store connection string value can be checked by looking at the cluster manifest contents returned by .

param.name: applicationPackagePath
param.para: The full path to the source application package.

param.name: applicationPackagePathInImageStore

param.name: progressHandler
param.para: The progress handler to retrieve real time progress information

param.name: timeout
param.para: The timeout of copying application package operation

summary.para: Uploads an application package to the Image Store in preparation for provisioning a new application type.

exception.para: There was an error accessing a file on the Image Store.
A required file was not found on the Image Store.
A required directory was not found on the Image Store.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task CreateApplicationAsync (System.Fabric.Description.ApplicationDescription applicationDescription);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task CreateApplicationAsync(class System.Fabric.Description.ApplicationDescription applicationDescription) cil managed

param.name: applicationDescription
param.para: The description of the application.

summary.para: Creates and instantiates the specific Service Fabric application.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
: The create application request is not valid with respect to the provisioned manifests for the requested application type.
: The application name is not a valid Naming URI.
: A corrupted file was encountered on the image store.
: The application has already been created.
: The requested application type has not been provisioned yet.
There was an error accessing a file on the Image Store.
A required file was not found on the Image Store.
A required directory was not found on the Image Store.
A path to an Image Store file/directory was too long.
: There was an IO error communicating with the Image Store.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The application capacity parameters specified are incorrect. Refer to , and for correct specification of application capacity parameters.

: The application name is not a valid Naming URI.
: A corrupted file was encountered on the ImageStore.

: The requested application type has not been provisioned yet.

A required file was not found on the Image Store.
A required directory was not found on the Image Store.
A path to an Image Store file/directory was too long.
: There was an IO error communicating with the Image Store.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The application capacity parameters specified are incorrect. Refer to , and for correct specification of application capacity parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task DeleteApplicationAsync (System.Fabric.Description.DeleteApplicationDescription deleteApplicationDescription);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task DeleteApplicationAsync(class System.Fabric.Description.DeleteApplicationDescription deleteApplicationDescription) cil managed

param.name: deleteApplicationDescription
param.para: The description of the application to be deleted.

summary.para: Deletes the application instance from the cluster and deletes all services belonging to the application.

remarks.para: All application state will be lost and cannot be recovered after the application is deleted.
A forceful deletion call can convert on-going normal deletion to forceful one.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
: The application does not exist.
: The application is being upgraded.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task MoveNextApplicationUpgradeDomainAsync (System.Fabric.ApplicationUpgradeProgress upgradeProgress);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task MoveNextApplicationUpgradeDomainAsync(class System.Fabric.ApplicationUpgradeProgress upgradeProgress) cil managed

param.name: upgradeProgress
param.para: –The Upgrade progress of the application instance of interest. This provides information about the next upgrade domain to be upgraded.

summary.para: Instructs the Service Fabric to upgrade the application instance in the next upgrade domain.

remarks.para: Service Fabric would only move to the next upgrade domain if it has completed the upgrade domain it is currently updating. In other words, property should be Pending before calling this method.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
: The application does not exist.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

param.name: upgradeProgress
param.para: The upgrade progress of the application instance of interest. This provides information about the next upgrade domain to be upgraded.

param.name: timeout
param.para: The maximum amount of time the system will allow this operation to continue before returning .

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: The that the operation is observing. It can be used to propagate notification that the operation should be canceled.

summary.para: Instructs the upgrade to continue with the application instance in the next upgrade domain.

remarks.para: Service Fabric would only move to the next upgrade domain if it has completed the upgrade domain it is currently updating. In other words, property should be Pending before calling this method.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
: The application does not exist.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task UnprovisionApplicationAsync (System.Fabric.Description.UnprovisionApplicationTypeDescription description);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task UnprovisionApplicationAsync(class System.Fabric.Description.UnprovisionApplicationTypeDescription description) cil managed

param.name: description
param.para: Describes parameters for the unprovision operation.

summary.para: Unregisters and removes a Service Fabric application type from the cluster.

remarks.para: This method can only be called if all application instance of the application type has been deleted. Once the application type is unregistered, no new application instance can be created for this particular application type.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
: The application type is being used by one or more applications.
: The application does not exist.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

: The application type is being used by one or more applications.
: The application does not exist.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task UnprovisionApplicationAsync (string applicationTypeName, string applicationTypeVersion, TimeSpan timeout, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task UnprovisionApplicationAsync(string applicationTypeName, string applicationTypeVersion, valuetype System.TimeSpan timeout, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

param.name: applicationTypeName
param.para: The name of the application type.

param.name: applicationTypeVersion
param.para: The version of the application type.

param.name: timeout
param.para: The maximum amount of time the system will allow this operation to continue before returning .

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: The that the operation is observing. It can be used to propagate notification that the operation should be canceled.

summary.para: Unregisters and removes a Service Fabric application type from the cluster.

remarks.para: This method can only be called if all application instance of the application type has been deleted. Once the application type is unregistered, no new application instance can be created for this particular application type.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
: The application type is being used by one or more applications.
: The application does not exist.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task UpdateApplicationAsync (System.Fabric.Description.ApplicationUpdateDescription applicationUpdateDescription);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task UpdateApplicationAsync(class System.Fabric.Description.ApplicationUpdateDescription applicationUpdateDescription) cil managed

exception.para: : The application name is not a valid Naming URI.
: The application does not exist.
: Another application update is already in progress.
The application update parameters specified are incorrect. Refer to , and for correct specification of application capacity parameters.

It is possible that parameters in are valid, but when combined with existing application capacity parameters they produce an invalid combination. For example, setting to a value that is higher than the one that was specified in when application was created.

param.name: updateDescription
param.para: Description of parameters to modify. Unspecified parameters are left unmodified and will retain their current value in the upgrade.

summary.para: Modifies the upgrade parameters of a pending application upgrade.

exception.para: : There is no pending application upgrade to modify.

param.name: upgradeDescription
param.para: The description of the upgrade policy and the application to be upgrade.

summary.para: Performs upgrade on an application instance.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
: The upgrade is invalid with respect to the provisioned manifests.
: The application type does not exist.
: The application name is not a valid Naming URI.
: A corrupted file was encountered on the image store.
: The application does not exist.
: The application is already being upgraded to the requested version.
There was an error accessing a file on the image store.
A required file was not found on the image store.
A required directory was not found on the image store.
A path to an image store file/directory was too long.
: There was an IO error communicating with the image store.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
